alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 11:37AM MST until July 30 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Fire scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 1136 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Fire scar. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Fire scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wupatki Trails, Fernwood, Timberline and Lockett Meadow Campground. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 426 and 433. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Pipeline Fire scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
